page.title: 19Village Businesses
page.content: In 1920{Sweatman's Garage}was a wheelwrights and cycle makers but it gradually became a garage as cars gained popularity. Mr. Sweatman has worked there for 36 years since he was 14. He sells petrol and car parts and services and repairs cars. The {Workshop}owned by Mr.Cheesmur has been in use for 100 years. Mr.Ovenden has made Cottage Style Furniture there for the last 6 months. He has 7 machines. The{Coal Yard}has been working for 60 years though the company has been in existence for 100 years. Originally coal was delivered by barge to a yard at Black Wall. Later it was delivered by rail and now it comes by road. It is the Hinds family's business and they also run a farm.{Church Stores where we buy food dates back to 1789. It used to be a bakery and still has a flour hoist and stable.
